metadata.title: CVE-2023-5345 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's fs/smb/clientcomponent can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. In caseof an error in smb3_fs_context_parse_param, ctx->password was freed but thefield was not set to NULL which could lead to double free. We recommendupgrading past commit e6e43b8aa7cd3c3af686caf0c2e11819a886d705.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
